Alcântara Launch Center
Centro de Lançamento de Alcântara
Location of the Alcântara Launch Center

  • ICAO: SNCW

Elevation AMSL 148 ft / 45 m
Coordinates 02°22′23″S 44°23′47″W﻿ / ﻿2.37306°S 44.39639°W﻿ / -2.37306; -44.39639Coordinates: 02°22′23″S 44°23′47″W﻿ / ﻿2.37306°S 44.39639°W﻿ / -2.37306; -44.39639

Sources: CLA Airport Info[1]

The Alcântara Launch Center (Portuguese: Centro de Lançamento de Alcântara (CLA)) is a satellite launching facility of the Brazilian Space Agency in the city of Alcântara, located on Brazil's northern Atlantic coast, in the state of Maranhão.[2] It is operated by the Brazilian Air Force (Comando da Aeronáutica). The CLA is the closest launching base to the equator. This gives the launch site a significant advantage in launching geosynchronous satellites, an attribute shared by the Guiana Space Centre.

Construction of the base began in 1982. The first launch occurred on February 21, 1990, when the sounding rocket Sonda 2 XV-53 was launched.[citation needed]

So far,[when?] only sounding rockets and VLS rockets have been launched from Alcântara. On August 22, 2003, the explosion of the third VLS-1 (XV-03) killed 21 people.[citation needed]

There are also plans to launch several international rockets from Alcântara. In 2003 contracts were signed to launch Ukrainian Tsyklon-4[3] (as of December 2009 planned to be launched by the end of 2010[2]) and Israeli Shavit[4] rockets; In addition there are further plans to launch the Russian Proton rocket.[5]. In the beginning of 2018, Brazilian government offered the possibility to use the spaceport to several U.S. companies.[6]

Structures[edit]

  • Engine preparation facilities (Preparação de Propulsores - PPP)
  • Payload preparation facilities (Preparação de Carga Útil - PPCU)
  • Liquid-fuel loading facilities (Preparação de Carregamento de Propelentes - PCPL)
  • Universal launch tower
  • Mobile Integration Tower (TMI - Torre Móvel de Integração): 33x10x13m, 380tons. Used for assembly of the VLS rockets.
  • Control center (Prédio de Controle Avançado - CASAMATA).
  • 2600m runway

List of launchpads[edit]

VLS rocket on a launching pad in Alcântara.

The Alcântara launch pads include:[citation needed]

  • VLS Pad (with Mobile Integration Tower - TMI) 2°19′04″S 44°22′04″W﻿ / ﻿02.31770°S 44.36779°W﻿ / -02.31770; -44.36779﻿ (VLS Pad)
  • MRL Pad (general sounding rocket pad) 2°18′58″S 44°22′02″W﻿ / ﻿02.31608°S 44.36730°W﻿ / -02.31608; -44.36730﻿ (MRL Pad)
  • "Universal" pad for rockets up to 10 tons 2°18′58″S 44°22′04″W﻿ / ﻿02.31599°S 44.36782°W﻿ / -02.31599; -44.36782﻿ ("Universal" Pad)
  • Alcântara Cyclone Space (ACS)[7] Pad 2°17′05″S 44°23′08″W﻿ / ﻿2.2847597°S 44.3854562°W﻿ / -2.2847597; -44.3854562﻿ (ACS Pad) (Tsyklon-4, under construction, launch after 2015[8])
